text: Can from trade. Thanks russel. Pours with a heavy pulp and almost pulp like head and consistency . Nice and bright passion fruit and guava notes. Great all around. Love be it.
Marvelously crushable double IPA. Hop aroma wafts across the room. Orange citrus, good mouthfeel for DIPA. Very well crafted. Thanks Joe for hooking me up.

500ml can. Pours hazy pale amber. A bit darker than Scaled... more organge. Nose big fruity and earthy notes. Floral and oily. Taste very fruiry. Mangos, passion fruits, oranges. Floral and oily. Finish oily and slightly resinous. Earthy. Packed with hops. Awesome stuff.

This is good. Not Heavy Mettle good, but just a powerhouse beer. Trillium is the arnie to the treehouse stallone. Beefier, bulkier and more fun to watch/drink. huge tropical fruit platter with that puffy, creamy body.

Bottle via trade. Pours a murky/hazy burnt orange with a two-finger eggshell head. Nice lace. Aromos of the usual tropical fruit (papaya, mango), cat piss, fresh cut flowers, light breadcrumbs and a hint of earth. Taste is loaded with bright papaya, mango, peaches, etc. Some cannabis and grassy notes. Light bready notes from pilsner malt....light bitter in the end. Finishes semi-dry with more of the tropical notes. Tasty!

Un liquide complètement voilé, orange, avec une petite carbonatation. Au nez, explosion de fruits, avec les mangues, pêches et fruits de la passion qui dansent tous ensemble en arômes. Le nez est franchement impressionnant. En bouche, cest littéralement un jus dorange, pulpe en moins, ponctuée dune petite amertume qui vient ensuite. Cest plein dagrumes, sans aucun gout dalcool, avec un beau corps bien réalisé. Cette bière est un classique du genre.

Draft @ The Rare Barrel, Berkeley, CA. Pours a hazy yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty citrus hoppy bitter peachy aroma. Fruity malty citrus hoppy bitter peachy flavor. Has a fruity malty peachy hoppy bitter citrus finish.

Tasted from can. Pours a super murky ora he with white head. Aroma is tangerine, mango, passion fruit. Taste is well balanced. Flavors of mango, peach, tangerine, papaya, crackers. Incredibly well done IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 16, 2017 Murky yellows w pour, smaller offwhite head, good lacing. Pineapple, stonefeuit, tropical fruit in the aroma and taste, rinds, slightly dank, light onion and herbs, fairly sweet. Medium body.

Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is citrus, pineapple, mango, earthy and floral. Taste is bitter sweet, lots of citrus tartness that turns sweet. Medium bodied, slick with dry finish. Excellent

Pours a very cloudy, muddy orange-yellow, with almost no head. Aroma has some citrus, some tropical fruit, some...onion? Flavor is very citrusy, with tropical fruit, a ton of hop bite--pine and spruce. Finish is quite bitter. Mouthfeel is very soft. Another winner from this brewer.
Can. Pours milky yellow with foamy off-white head, sharp citrus aroma, high carbonation, bitter citrus peel taste with some pineapple, thickish body, long bitter citrus peel finish. A very good DIPA.

Tallboy can from an IP with Tracygee. Poured New England style. Aroma of mango, lime, apricot, tropical fruits, rotting citrus fruits and sugars. Flavor is not as sweet with rotting fruits but has more citrus rind, dry sugar, cracker, bread crusts. Medium to fuller body, tight bubbly carbonation and a quicker fading AT. Good but I actually preferred the Magnify I had right before over this.

Trillium Vicinity. Aroma maravilhoso, explosivo. Perfil de Dry hopping diferente das outras Trillium. Excelente! 4.45/5

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can 1pt. [ As Trillium Vicinity ].Unclear - hazy medium orange color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting to diminishing, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, moderate to heavy hoppy, citrus, grapefruit, peach. Flavor is moderate sweet and light heavy bitter with a long duration, citrus, grapefruit, peach, hoppy, juicy, dry, fresh hops. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20170302]
 9-4-8-3-17

At a tasting, almost no head, murky palish orange color, aroma of pineapple, guava and mango, flavor is am melange of fresh fruit, citrus peel and a hint of onion, sweet but not heavy. Excellent, really enjoyable.

Gylden uklar skum hvid 
Citrus grape korn malt frugt 
Bitter meget sød lidt 
Oile blød 
@f1 
10 gamle

Can shared at a tasting at Tom Ls place. Murky yellow. Juicy fruity hops aroma, tropical, a bit oniony. Rather dry flavor, with light fruity sweetness, and juicy fruity hops, "green", moderately bitter. Medium-bodied. Really good and easy-drinking.

Hazy golden yellow. Nice citrus aroma. Not overly hoppy or bitter. A very drinkable 8% NE Dble IPA. Ive yet to have a bad IPA from these guys. I work nearby, if youre looking for a Trillium trade let me know.

Canette 473ml, gracieuseté de tom10101, merci Tommy! Couleur jaune-orange trouble, mousse blanche. Arôme de pomélo, écorce de pomélo, malt, houblon résineux. Goût de houblon résineux, pomélo, amertume moyenne-élevée, malt, orange. Carbonatation moyenne, corps moyen-dense, texture ample.
16oz can pours a hazy yellow color with a bit of head. Mild hop bitterness. Mild tropical flavors. Easy going. Slightly noticeable alcohol.

Can. It pours a cloudy yellow color with a white head. The aroma has grapefruit, orange and hints of melon. The flavor has strong grapefruit with a little sweet peach and melon. Medium grassy bitternss. A tad chewy on the palate, and a little muddled even for a NE IPA. Good though.

Bright cloudy orange gold. 
Huge juicy nose and flavor, continuing the they can do no wrong conversation (though no, I didnt try never & Again).
Tropical fruit and tart citrus abound.
Very hoppy, thought only lightly to moderately bitter. Great feel. Bright and delicious.

Can, by way of a trade. Super hazy, dark yellow. Film and ring of sticky, lasting, white head. Nose has pithy grapefruit. Orange peel. Pine needle. A little woody herb. Vanilla malts in the background. Taste is juicy, citrus pulp bitter. Light sweetness. Foamy mouthfeel. Get a bit of the ABV with this one. Citrusy, zesty bitter finish.

16oz can c/o Smith. Hazy bright orange-yellow body. Foamy off-white head. Big, bold passionfruit tones, but still has a lot of other hop depth. The above description sort of nails it. Really drinkable stuff, World Class IIPA all the way. Bright, clean, juicy hops. Pleasant malt backdrop, not super thin or one-dimensional, but easy going enough to really help accentuate the hops. Awesome beer.

Very cloudy golden pour with creamy white head. Fresh citrus tropic hoppy aroma. Juicy delicious citrus, mango, peach, passion fruit and a hint dank. Finish is tangerine citrus. Tremendous. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Servida en un Spiegelau IPA.

APARIENCIA: de color ámbar, turbia, con una mediana baja actividad de carbonatación, se observan algunos restos de sedimento en el líquido. Corona de espuma color blanco de mediana baja retención, de burbujas compactas y abiertas.

AROMA: de inicio muy herbal, predominantemente dankness, atrás las notas a frutos cítricos y tropicales que se esperan: jugo de uva blanca, lichi, guayaba, melón, papaya, lima. Cuando el líquido toma más temperatura, las características frutales relucen un poco más, pero al agitar la copa vuelve a predominar lo herbal.

SABOR: predominan y explotan los sabores de frutos tropicales, notas a jugo de uva blanca, lichi, guayaba, papaya, melón, mango verde, algo de cítricos como mandarina y cáscara de lima, algo de dankness y pasto recién cortado no tan presente como en aroma, y las maltas como galleta neutra o crackery. El retrogusto queda un amargor medio largo pegado al paladar, algo de gusto verde como pasto y resina queda remanente.

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo medio con mediana baja carbonatación.

RESUMEN: buena east coast IPA
Bottle - Citrus and grassy light funk. Clearish gold with a small white head. Bitter citrus peel and lots of Mandarin.

Hunted by Sergey, canCloudy golden color, small head. The aroma is strong, hoppy, musk, pungent. Rather dry for a Double IPA, the hopping is very strong, overwhelming any possible malt, juicy and pungent, sweet oranges, hop resins; tickling final, a bit floury though.Excellent.
Tasting at Alexs. 473ml, canned on ??-Oct-2016 (thx, Alex G.!). Pours a hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is tropical fruits, earthy. Taste is pretty the same. Good stuff.

Can at home, canned three weeks ago. Probably the best beer Ive tasted. Hazy and golden hop juice with a thin, white head. Aroma is mostly ripe mango, taste is smooth with no sign of the ABV, lots of dank tropical fruits.

Simply one of the best beers Ive ever had. As soon as I opened the can, the aromas came pouring out. This beer was quite an experience. I dont have all of the words to describe it, but this beer is a work of art. I hope I can get my hands on it again sometime.

Can at home, gifted from Matt C. A toast to Buddy on his 11th B-Day. A deep gold pour with lots of yeasty floaties. Lots of citrus and stonefruits on the nose. Crackery malt, passionfruit, sage, grass, hay, apricot, fresh oily galaxy hops on the finish. Wow....Happy Birthday Buddy!
Can @ MeadMe share, at Fermentoren. Hazy golden, yellowish pour with a small head. Loads og juicy hops, grapes, tangerine and a light sweet malt backbone.

Super pale gold with a filmy white head and a dank earthy pine aroma. Two months old but it remains insanely juicy and dry but with sufficient residual sweetness to impress. Top knotch. Amazingly good for being 2 months old.
Can. Nose of grapefruit, some cat piss. Pale pastel yellow with lace. Dry, bready malt flavor, crackers, tropical fruit, a bit of pine. Soft, lovely body. Excellent and very dry.

475 ml can (2 months old) at home. Light hazy yellow golden color with off white head. Hoppy and malty aroma, light floral, citrusy fruity, tropical fruits, light grass, wheat. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.
Can. Color hazy yellow with medium white head. Aroma hoppy, pine, malt, orange. Taste pine, grapefruit, hoppy, fruits, bitter, spicy.
Can thanks to bursprak! Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aromas of sweet mango, dank hops, citrus, orange, lychee, peach. Taste is dank, juicy, mango, pineapple, citrus.

Can I dunno how old? Pours cloudy golden orange with a white head. Aroma of dank hops, sweet citrus, orange, peach and slight bread. Taste of dank hops, citrus, orange, peach, pine, minty and hop pallets. Awesome!

From can thanks to Bursprak. Pours a rather "clear" golden with a big white head. Aroma has a rather planty, earthy, green sticks, citrus, grape fruit, pilsner malts!
Taste is dry, crisp, super planty, but still malty sweet, low bitterness. Average high carbonation and a light body for the ABV.

Pint can. Pours an unfiltered, murky orange yellow straw colored gold with a medium white head. Aroma of tropical fruit, bitter hops, mild grape juice and sweet grapefruit. Taste of tropical fruit, juicy hops and lightly sweetened grapefruit.

can recieved in a trade, poured a cloudy deep yellow colour with a white head. nose of fresh citrus notes, sweet riped orange, light tangerines, ripe grapes. taste of big juicy tropical fruits, mango, sticky mouthfeel. big fruit juice ipa.
Can thanks to Joe H. Pours hazy light gold with a thin white head. Foot, lemon drop and pineapple. Light bitter finish. Light mouth feel good carbonation.

UPDATED: OCT 27, 2016 Cannette. Couleur jaune or, un peu voilée, mousse blanche. Arôme de houblons, malt, et échalotte...eh oui...Pas autant aromatique que je mattendais. En bouche, malt, houblon, très légère amertume. Bonne mais vraiment pas à la hauteur du hype...

Hasy golden/honey pour with a medium creamy white head. Aroma has nice citrus...pithy, tangerine, orange...with some herbal, scalliony notes. Flavor follows suit...just a bit more herbal and scalliony...awesome balance of fruity and earthy/herbal hops. Mouthfeel is medium and creamy/oily yet lively with a dry resinous/earthy/herbal finish. Excellent.
Leuchtend orange im Glas, leicht trüb, wenig grober schaum, leicht orangig in der der Nase, weich im Antrunk, runder Körper, schön fruchtig orangig, nur leichte bittere im Abgang, schön ausgewogen.
At Hopishop 2016. Aroma of fresh hops, citrus, pine and peach. Taste has pine, citrus, peach, malt and fresh mildly grassy hops. This is good stuff.

Mooi goudgeel licht troebel bier met fijne witte schuimkraag. Zeer fris, fruitig in de neus. Lichte kattepisgeur (maar zeker niet storend). Heerlijk fris hoppig in de mond. Ananas, witte druif, hop, citrus. Frisse licht bittere afdronk. Zéér zéér goed.
(can) hazy, bright, pale yellow orange colour with a medium tall white head; aroma of tropical fruit, honey; balanced flavour, well hidden alcohol, long light bitter finish; amazingly good

Can. Hazy light golden yellow. Firm white head. Aroma is slight pineapple, mango, some more fruits with a touch of dank. Incredibly easy on the tongue. Excessive fruityness with a long bitter finish. Does it get any better than this for the style?
Poured a hazy light orange color with a white head. Aroma was big pineapple and peach, light resin and earthy character too. Flavor similar, a bit orangey in there too. Medium bitterness.
750ml bottle purchased at Canton, MA brewery. Very, Very good beer. Wow. Fruity and hoppy throughout. Citrus and tropical fruitiness allows you to drink it like juice. Thick and smooth full body.
Can in a trade. Typical slightly cloudy golden yellow pour with a white head. Aromas of peaches and melon with some tangerine and grapefruit in there. One of my favorite combos of hops. Just great.

Several oz. pour from a bottle; thanks to falco242. Consumed on 8-30-16. Pours a cloudy, light brass with a moderate amount of beige head. Funky, dry aroma with some tropical fruitiness. Funky, citric taste features flavors of pineapple and gin. Frothy and smooth in the palate. Medium body.
Phenomenal beer. Bottle brought back from the brewery. Great aroma with hints of citrus and hops. Creamy taste with hop and fruit and then it finishes crisp and clean. Really impressive.
Bottle courtesy of Falco242. Citra hop aroma. very hazy yellow body. Really great flavor. Similar to Todd the axe man but with funk! Outstanding!
16 ounce can. Pours a hazy golden orange with a nice white head. Aroma of citrus and tropical. Taste is grapefruit, pineapple, orange, mango, malt, and floral. Deserves its ratings.

Tasted on 8/1/16 from a 16oz can, big thanks to Alex for this one. Pours turbid orange/yellow with a thick white head that slowly recedes to average lace, leaving some sticky residue along the inside of the glass. The nose is tons of mango and tropical fruit, very floral and aromatic, with some herbal green hops, and the lightest hint of orange blossom honey. The flavor is very juicy with the same tropical fruit, some over-ripe, along with the citrus zest, light spice, and lightly bitter herbal green note. The body is nearly full with average carbonation, and a long lightly bitter herbal, but mostly floral tropical fruit finish.

16 oz can. Hazy bright orange. Small white head that settles to a thin collar. Smells of tropical fruit with just a hint of grapefruit pungency. Tastes again of tropical fruit, but with some tangerine. Lightly sweet. Grapefruit hop finish with low bitterness. Medium body. Very easy to drink. Not at all heavy or sweet. Very impressive.

16oz can. Milky golden orange with a foamy white head. Flavors are resinous hops, pine needles, cannabis, garlic, lime, pineapple, passion fruit and alcohol with grassy and spicy notes. Medium body, soft to moderate carbonation, smooth texture.

Bottle - 750mL crowned. Courtesy of my friend Noel. Thanks! Cloudy golden amber with a short white head. Aroma is strong tropical fruit and citrus with floral hops and orange juice. Taste is tropical fruit, citrus fruit, orange juice, floral hops and soft malt. Body is medium with a soft bubbly carbonation and a light lingering hop bitterness. Dry finish. Ends with more floral hops, tropical fruit, citrus fruit, orange juice and soft malt.

Can shared with Jaz from Andrew Harries; hazy golden yellow pour with a thin tan head, aroma has zesty grapefruit along with some dank pine, taste has orange, grapefruit , mellow IBU, mango, a hint of spice.

Can dated 7/12/16. Thanks Steve for picking this up for us. Have had a couple fresh bottles as well, but rating the can and to boot I like this out of this can a little bit more than the bottles. Cloudy orange, initial large frothy head that fades, some sticky lace left on the glass after numerous sips. Nose is lychee, passionfruit, grapefruit--absolutely delightful. Soft, pillowy mouthfeel with citrus, lychee, lightly bitter grapefruit peel finish but you have to reach for it. Another fantastic Trillium.

Bottle. Aroma is pineapple juice, mango, oranges and dank hops. Tastes super juicy with just enough dankness to counter it. Orange and pineapple juice all the way. Medium to full body. Crushable. Mild to moderate bitterness in the finish. Great east coast DIPA.

Pours cloudy golden color with white head. Amazing aroma of tropical fruit, citrus and potent,dank , pine resin. Oily mouthfeel. Flavor is grapefruit, pineapple, mangos, and peaches. Some acidic bite. Finishes with grapefruit rind and dank pine. Some lingering bitterness. This brew is a fantastic experience.

Bottle poured into a shaker showing opaque yellow with a finger of clean white foam. 

The nose shows strong intense pineapple and grapefruit. 

The palate is medium bodied and well carbonated. Strong, sharp and vibrant flavors of juicy grapefruit and pineapple with a light harmonious malt note on the mid palate. The finish is shows a lightly sharp but barely noticeable pilsner-like bitterness. Once again, another great beer from Trillium.
Fresh bomber. This is another textbook Trillium hoppy beer. Its cloudy, creamy-soft, and ludicrously aromatic, and I drank it all way too quickly.

Shared 25.4 oz. bottle. Hazy gold with a white head. Aroma is very fruity with lots of citrus and tropical fruit. Taste follows nose. Very fruity and juicy with moderate pine notes and a mildly bitter finish. Excellent.

Bottle pours out a light peach color topped with a small head. Nose is floral hops citrus some earthy notes and a nice malt sweetness. Taste is more of the nice hop leafy citrus and a light malty note.

Taster pour at Sierra Nevada Beer Camp Across America. Aroma is corn chip, pine, resin. Appearance is cloudy light, straw yellow with ring of white head, mild lacing. Taste is mostly corn chip with pine. Palate is medium bodied with average texture, average carbonation and dry, mildly bitter piney finish. Overall, a nice balance of sweet and bitter and I liked it, but it was not at all like the description.

On draft at Trillium Canton. The pour is, you guessed it, a bright tropical juice color with a thinner ring of white head that falls down leaving a spot or two of lace. The aroma is dank and leafy. There is a bit of juiciness that rolls through the back end, but its really interesting. Definitely more leafy hop and bitterness than I was expecting. The flavor is quite a bit different. There is a bigger citrus and lightly bitter fruit rind to go with a softer hop. The da knees really goes away and the leafiness doesnt play a role anymore. The mouth feel is good. Lighter and crisp with a medium carbonation and a lingeringly light bitter juiciness. Its pretty damn tasty.

Sample at Trillium Canton with koleminer20. Aroma is dank, citrus, grass, tropical fruit, good. Appearance is orange juice, hazy orange with a white head. Taste is juicy as fuck, tons of tropical fruit, slight dank, citrus, pine, damn. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light crisp carbonation, juicy aftertaste. Overall, good lord. This is amazing.

Bottled. Thx rlgk
Hazy golden with a medium, white head. 
Piney, fruity and slightly vinous aroma. 
Pine-needles, grapes, wet grass, tropical fruits.

Vaffanculo,la perfezione. Aroma di frutti tropicali,aRancia,marmellata darancia, aghi di pino. Giallo oro antico, amvrato, sapore di agrumi,frutta tropicale, aghi di pino, nocciolo di pesca, consistenza oleosa. Veramente meravigliosa, birra irripetibile

Bottle. Pours murky orange with a thin white head that lingers. Grapefruit aroma over medium carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle thanks to Brian. Pours a cloudy yellow gold with medium off white head that lasts leaving sticky lacing. The aroma is tropical fruit and onion. Medium mouth, juicy, dank hop, onion, light bitterness, crushable, very good.

Aroma: very fruity and juicy; Appearance: hazy orange with thin white head that dissipates quickly; Taste: smooth and complex with bitterness thats not overwhelming; more similar to Tree House Bright; very enjoyable; good malt backbone; Palate: medium body with long, sweet/bitter finish; Overall: excellent; probably my favorite Trillium so far.

Bottle shared by Kmg284, thanks man. Pours hazy golden with small white head. Onion and twangy grass, some kiwi. Really easy going for a double, tastes less sweet than the ddh melcher we had same session. Bitter and funky. Columbus lighter which is nice. Not a big double IPA fan anymore but this one is solid.

Bottle tasting if several trilliums. The pour is the mildest of the bunch. The aroma is big on hops, some pine and citrus. You can tell this is the double ipa of the bunch in the taste. A little lingering bitterness to the aftertaste. Solid. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

July 24, 2015. Bottle, bottled July 22, 2015. 
Cloudy pale yellow with a medium sized frothy white head. Aroma is fruity and hoppy with grapefruit, orange zest, mango, resin, pine, grass, white bread and hints of earthy wood notes. Taste is light to medium sweet, smooth bitter. Finish is sweet mango, resin, hints of white bread with a smooth citrusy, grassy and piney bitterness. Smooth, slight creamy texture, medium bodied, soft to average carbonation. 
Great!

750ml bottle with a date of 3/7/16

Very juicy DIPA. 

Great carbonation / super beer
Bottle shared by Bruce. Pours haze orange copper. Nice fruity citrus aroma. Taste is Tropical hops with a big grapefruit dry finish
Pours a cloudy deep yellow, thin white head. Aroma is straight juice - grapefruit, mango, grass, pineapple, pure orange, guava. Flavor is fruit juice, super drinkable.

Bottle. Pours hazy golden orange with off white head. Aroma is Orange Grapefruit Juice. A little pine as well. Taste is sweet grapefruit, orange, pineapple, and papaya with a warm alcohol piney fruity finish. A little booze on the finish which isnt my personal preference, however Excellent beer.

Bottle... Pours hazy and golden with a small, creamy, white head. Great retention. The aroma is a mélange of grapefruit, pine resin and musk. Light-bodied with stinging carbonation. The flavor is bright, refreshing and bitter with a light, odd, beefy component. Lengthy, lightly bitter, slightly acidic finish. Thanks to the Palm Beach County crew for sharing!

Poured into a snifter. Big thanks to NizzleEGizzle for hooking me up.

3.25 A: Murky, but "bright" orange brown color. Less than a finger of creamy off-white head formed. Retention is well below average given the style. A few scattered wisps of lacing are left behind.

4.5 S: Pretty awesome nose on this. Huge lemongrass right from the start. Grapefruit and pith, orange, touch of lemon. Secondarily floral with coriander and white pepper-esque spiciness. Clean overall, but theres a hint of bready yeastiness. 

3.75 T: While the nose is vibrant, the taste is more subdued. To start, for a DIPA, theres only a very mild bitterness. The hops are almost equally floral and citrusy, while the nose was more citrus forward. Still lots of lemongrass with grapefruit and orange following. Finishes with the same mild spiciness.

3.75 M: Medium body. Good moderate carbonation. Theres some creaminess but I could use some more.

4.0 D: Solid beer, but doesnt quite live up to expectations.

★ 1,008 characters


DavoleBomb, Jan 10, 2016

On tap at Row 34. Aroma: wow! Citrus all over the place. Oranges, clementines etc. Wow! This is awesome! App: extremely hazy, looks like a 100% pulp juice. Orange whitish, pear. That sure is a look I like. Taste and palate: medium body, so fruity but surprising abrupt moderate bitter and fruity finish. Overall: damn this is good. Too cold though but not the brewerys fault.

Campground Brewdown 2015. Pours a hazed gold with a thin white head. Bright citrus, musk on the nose. Medium-bodied, cool citrus, soft musk. Yeast. Soft malt and light wheat with a gentle musk into the finish.

Backlog 150806
Poor memory on this one except that it was very hoppy and grapefruit. Normally like that very much, but this one was not my favourite. Would like to try it again though...

Bottle thanks to FooFaa Dan. Nose is super fruity with a moderate citrus and tropical touch to it. Not too danky. Hazy, golden orange with a medium white head, tight tiny bubbles. Excellent retention. Nose is more orange marmalade as it warms. Taste is a quite pleasant orange-ish grapefruit with a moderate pepper and spiciness to it. A tad different than the aroma leant me to believe it would be, and still pleasant. No sign of alcohol and very refreshing. Nice.

[ bottle ][ 1oz ][ @Tasting ][ $ ? ][ snifter ][ 12.06.15 ]translucent gold, thin white head laces all over. Plenty of caramel, light orange in nose, honey and floral elements. Front palate is smoooooooooooth. Soft orange, light caramel, oily and resin building through the rich finish, light metallicity. Balanced but not stand out after the palate.

Sampled at CBOs tasting. A very nice Double IPA. Complex citrus and tropical fruit. Throw in some pine and floral. A lot of delicious hops going on here. I didnt notice the alcohol. Soft malts mostly stayed out of the way.

Pour out of 750 mL bottle, thanks solidfunk! Hazy dark orange pour with white head, aroma brought notes of big orange juice, tropical fruit, hints of slight dank notes with a touch of pine, slight spice. Taste was more on the dank side, some slight orange, touch of pineapple, hints of mango, slight biscuit, finishing slightly bitter, slightly sweet. Lived up to the hype for me, excellent tropical fruit forward double.

750ml bottle pours a clear gold with some spitty, white head. Nose has honey comb, orange, tangerine, some tropical fruit. Flavor is sweet, honey, a little brown sugar, orange, soap, pine resin, spice. Full bodied, sticky finish.
Hazy gold pour, white head. Aroma is unbelievable. Mango, pineapple, coconut, pine and grass, wild honey. Great flavor of grapefruit, pine, mango, resin.
Citrus and some booze. Very nice but over hyped. Good balance but a touch too much booze. Orange pour with ok head. Bittersweet finish.

Bottle at the DC Mini Tasting. Hazy golden orange with off-white head. Aromas of tropical, garlic and onion, grapefruit citrus. Tastes of tropical fruit, floral, pine, garlic, citrus. Medium body with a dry finish.
Bottle. Clear golden color. Nice fruity aroma. Taste is bittersweet mixed summer fruit. Very tasty.
From a bottle shared at the DC mini tasting in December 2015. Pours a clea gold with an off white head. Juicy citrus nose. Flavors of orange and tropical fruits.

16/X/15 - 75cl bottle from a trade @ home - BB: n/a, bottled: VII/22/15 (2015-1489) Thanks to Chris for the trade and Thomas for muling!
Little cloudy blond to orange beer, creamy irregular yellowish head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: lots and lots of fruits, pineapple, passion fruit, grapefruit, orange peel. MF: soft carbon, medium to full body. Taste: very fruity, passion fruits, bitter, pineapple, mango. Aftertaste: fruity, caramel, sweet malty backbone supporting the harsh bitterness, very fruity, grapefruit, very nice beer!

[7522-20150815] Bottle. Sweet orange hops aroma. Hazy, light yellow orange body with a medium-lasting foamy white head. Bitter orange lemon hops flavour. Medium body is fairly bitter but has a nice sweet citrus. Tasty. (8/4/9/4/16) 4.1
(@ Campground Brewdown 2015, Millmont, PA)
Overheard: "Doesnt matter where you pull, somethings coming out."
Bottle from Harris over the summer. Nice citrusy aroma, medium bitterness but very drinkable(ie not heavy). Impressive.

Thanks to tderoeck! 750 ml. bottle sampled @ Tims orgasmic Trillium tasting. Bottled on 22/07/2015. Hazy orange with a big creamy head. Nose is fluffy candy, yeast with some sweetish dried mango. Taste is light floral bitterness, some yeast, dried mango, floral, bitter zest, most bitter Trillium beer so far. Body is a bit yeasty as was the case with the other Trillium beers (tad too much for). Interesting mix of floral bitterness & some dried mango + sweetish yeast. Quite nice, well done for sure. Rather liking it.

Une bière dorée et marécageuse se laisser dominer par une mousse qui prend la poudre descampette promptement. Des pêches juteuses, des agrumes vivifiants et un peu de sapin, voilà les éléments olfactifs qui me font saliver à tout coup. Ultra fruitée en bouche, un peu sucrée, pas du tout amère, une sensation buccale très juteuse qui enveloppe la langue à chaque gorgée, voilà les ingrédients qui font de cette bière une bombe houblonnée inoubliable.

Bottle from Pat, thanks buddy! Appearance is cloudy yellow with dense white head. Huge aroma, lots of citrus, dank hops, and loads of tropical fruit. Taste is orange, mango, and bitter hops. Great IIPA, aroma is fantastic, taste explodes with juicy flavour. Wow!

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2015 Pale murky color with white head. Aroma is very vegetal and herbal, with chive and dill notes. Taste is very fresh with the same vegetal and dank notes. Body is really smooth. Very tasty and easy to drink. Seems more like a single than a double IPA.

Dégustée sur l?heure du dîner en compagnie de Mademoiselle Irina. Nous vivons en ce moment, un Grand Moment. Nous ne saurions saluer plus bas la généreuse personne qui a rendu possible cet heureux événement! Cheers mon ami, tu viens dîner à la maison avec ta femme et tes enfants sous peu! La bière se présente arborant une robe jaune paille ainsi qu?un voile de mariée avec un diadème en guise de mousse à rendre jalouse la Princesse de Monaco! Jamais je n?ai dégusté une IIPA révélant une telle complexité aromatique : mangue, fruits tropicaux, herbe, champs de maïs, ananas, houblons... Ce n?est pas sublime, c?est divin! En bouche, il m?est impossible de nommer chacune des saveurs que je perçois en ce moment car elles sont si étroitement tissées qu?elles forment un tout d?un niveau de fabulosité jusqu?à présent inégalé pour moi. Mademoiselle Irina et moi sommes renversés. Grand merci à toi généreux ami et bonne fête SlovakSniper!

Bon, grâce à la gentillesse dune certaine personne, je bois présentement une bière de qualité supérieure. La robe est jaune et pleine de vitamines. Sa mousse solide et généreusement collante menchante. Le nez est fruité, complexe, floral, tonitruant, herbacé, tropical, boréal, sublime. Les ananas, les pamplemousses, le jus de lime, les orange pressées, le zeste de citron, les aiguilles de pin, les conifères, les fleurs, le gazon fraichement coupé, les herbes longues et les craquelins au poivre forment un tout grandement apprécié par mes papilles. En bouche, voilà un corps olympique, parfaitement sculpté pour mon palais. Et en finale, un superbe goût de céréales et une sensationnelle montée juteuse dagrumes et de notes florales délicieusement mielleuses. Embouteillée le 25 août 2015. Bue le 27 août 2015. La journée de ma fête. Aujourdhui, jai 42 ans et je viens de boire une bière fantastique.

2015-08-15. Hazy orange body nice beige head. 3+ Aroma is pleasantly hoppy, nice citrus.Flavour is nicely hoppy, nice citrusy character, light green hop vegetation touches. Smooth average plus bodied palate, good carbonation. Bottle at Campground Brewdown.

Bottle at a tasting home, Thanks to Hackobock (Jakob). Hazy golden beer with an offwhite head. Hoppy citrus fruity cedar and pine aroma. Hoppy pine and tropical fruits cedar citrus and herbal flavour with some caramell and hay hints. Love in a bottle!

Bottle thanks to Todd! You make me hate St. Louis just a little bit less:) Pours a mostly clear orange color with a medium white head. Massive resinous fruity hop nose, oranges, herbal tea. The flavor is big sweetness, malty sweet base, oranges, just a huge dominant late boil hop goodness. Lovely soft IPA. Drinkable as all hell. Awesome.

75cl bottle, thanks Dwyane. Medium white head atop hazy apple juice body, nice lacing. Aroma is moderately sweet, juicy orange, some pineapple, light tangerine. Taste is moderately sweet, grape, grapefruit, some tangerine. Medium-full body, some resin, acidity.

Bottle shared by "hannont". Colour...very light but very cloudy straw with a thick head. Nose...gobs of tropical fruit, lemon curd and hop dust. Palate...very dry, yet plush, and ultra hoppy, but the malt bill must be such that the hops do not lord over everyone! The mid palate is still dry and continuously fruity, with pineapple and quince in predominance. The finish ligers for many minutes.

(Bottle) Pours muddy orange wig an off white head. The aroma holds cedar, elderberries, tropical fruits, red berries, sweet citrus and white bready malt. The flavour is light sweet, medium to heavily bitter and tiny acidic with notes of fruits, grass pine and white bready malt. The mouthfeel is round and soft with a light to medium carbination. Lingering grapefruity bitterness. Medium bodied.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2015 Bottle courtesy of RLGK. Pours very hazy milky tiny burnt yellow with a fluffy and frothy white head that leaves some thick sticky lacing on the glass while dissipating. Smell is fruity and grassy with crackers, white bread, oatmeal flakes, grapefruit juice, blood orange juice, mango, pineapple, fresh strawberries, freshly cut grass, pine needles and lemon zest. Taste is tiny sweet, bitter, heavy fruity and heavy grassy. Mouthfeel is soft, round, astringent and medium bodied. Finish is slightly sweet and bitter with crackers, white bread, grapefruit juice, mango, pineapple, star fruit, pomelo, freshly cut grass, pine needles, minerals and lemon zest. Holy shit this is good! Balances sweetness and prominent yet suiting bitterness. Heavy fruity and heavy grassy. Amazing!!

Draught at Sommarprovning 2015-08-05. Cloudy pale golden with a nice offwhite head. Hoppy citrus and pine aroma, herbal, peach, cedar, grapefruit, pine apples, passion fruit, spicy notes. Hoppy pine and mango flavor, woody, cedar, citrus, herbal, diesel, caramel, oranges, lemon zest, lemongrass, some hay. Magic beer! Huge thanks to Hackobock. (Jakob).

Bottle. Pours cloudy amber with a small bubbly head. Aroma is fresh fruity hoppy passion fruit a bit sweet grainy. Flavor is sooo goood, fruity hoppy a bit pungeant nice sweet touch to balance the bitterness citrus and grapefruits.

Bottle shared in London. Huge thanks to Phil T. for procuring this and delivering, by hand, across an ocean within one week. Pours cloudy gold with a fluffy off-white head. Oily and dank hops in the nose, lots of ripe citrus, mango and melon. Medium sweet flavor with pale bready sugars, peach, lemon, more mango, orange. Medium to full bodied with fine, massaging carbonation. Resinous finish, lightly piney, with further mango, faint grass, juicy citrus fruits. Supremely vibrant and juicy. Wonderful.

Pours a completely hazy, lovely sun-yellow color, with a big, extremely stable head. 

Smells outstandingly dank, of a flooded backyard with flowers and lemon zest hints randomly added, almost a bit skunky, reminding me of leaf infused herbs. Out of that foundation onion and crispy orange rind are rising up, creating a pleasant, very focussed hop complexity. 

Has a higher carbonation, while the beer provides an enjoyable medium body, which remains refreshing, while featuring a fantastic hop bitterness.

Begins with grassy hops and a decent amount of toast, with lemon blending into that melange. Malts get a tad sweeter, as the lemon turn sun-bathed ripe and juicy, guided by the beers outstanding dankness. Finishes with a pleasant minerality, while the hops turn lemony dry, exhibiting wet grass and even more lime.

Its real hop punch unveils late, while it creates an immense intensity and doesnt leave the palate for a long while. Before that, the brew exhibits a fantastic, soft aqueous mouthfeel, adding to its dank character. The hops arent too diverse in this, while they unfold a fantastic, pungent lime defined punch. The beers high abv isnt noteable at all, as it drinks almost too easy, not providing a particularly huge body, but very convincing and focused in taste.
750, No date but tastes damn fresh. Citrus and grapefruit. Bright hops. Mild bitterness. Very good.

Aroma: Mildly Garlic, Mildly Piney

Appearance: Hazy Golden Straw Hue, Passes Some Light, White Head, Great Lacing

Taste: Piney, Mild Onions

Mouthfeel: Average Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Drying

Bottle split at Jack The Sipper leaves for the FBI again tasting, massive thanks to Trillium pimp Leighton, I look forward to their hop jus more than anything these days, 14/07/15.
Lightly hazed orange with a decent off white covering.
Nose is earthy hops, dankoclock, pine needle, straw, mandarin, light herbal strains.
Taste comprises big dank strides, on the turn melon, citric pith, pine resin, grapefruit.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation - perfect pitch, big dank wash up at the curtain call.
Xo Xolid again from the Trillium hop camp.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle. Light golden pour with white head. Herbal, grassy and citrus hoppy aromas. Full citrus hop tones, grassy and herbal hop flavors. Fresh.

14th July 2015Farewell Jack bottleshare at Craft Clerkenwell. Third of the Triumphant Trillium Triumvant! Thanks to a very generous Mr Smith. Very hazy gold beer, good cream colour head. Palate is airy and semi dry with decent fine carbonation. Airy dry malts with good creamy sweetness. Big skunky hops, getting a bit dirty but in a mud bath wresting good kind of way. Pine. Slightly resinous tropical fruits. Hop spicy finish. Comes together very well indeed.

Bottle @ The Clerkenwell Share. Thanks to Leighton! Hazy gold pour with a small white head. Big hoppy nose. Very aggressive lemon citrus and dank tropical flora. Sea breeze. Taste is pleasingly dry. Soft bready body that lets the hops shine. Herb garden, weed. Big citrus notes. Just a bit of syrupy heat that reveals the not inconsiderable ABV. Medium body, soft carbonation. great.

Bottle share at CBC Clerkenwell. Many thanks to LKS. Hazy orange, still, big foamy orange-tinged head, light lacing. Aroma is tropical fruits, passionfruit, piney, earthy. It also has a dankness - onion, garlic and fried breakfast from a van. Body is medium, foamy, light carbonation. Taste is dry, straw, grapefruit, oily pine, more onion. Finishes dry with a soft bitterness. A big hoppy beer, but also very drinkable with a nice dryness. Best of the day for me.

Bottle big thanks to Leighton. It pours cloudy gold with a decent white head. The nose is so soft, juicy, passion fruit, mango, apricot, Five alive fruit juice, pissy hops, pine and some dank grassy action in the background. The taste is soft, juicy, very peachy indeed, mango, dank hops, grass, crisp minerals, toasty grain, bready malt and just a touch of alcohol with a crisp, clean finish. Medium body and moderate, velvety carbonation. Balance is unbelievable. Massive drinkability. Wow.

Bottle shared at craft beer co JackL leaving drinks. Huge thanks to Leighton for this one. Hazed yellow golden coloured pour with a lasting loose white head. Aroma is danky, oniony hop, lemon, juicy hop. Flavour is composed of big juicy hop. Lemon, mango, grassy. Burnt grass. Huge blend of hops. Palate is medium. Sticky, moderate carbonation. Very tasty.
Hell malziger, rund hopfiger Antrunk. Vollmundig, sehr grasig, süß. Hefig hopfiger Nachgeschmack. Fantastisch. 12/12/12/12/8/12

Ive got Trillium some shit, but this beer is the real deal. Medium orange, cloudy body, big bright white head. Super juicy fruit forward on the nose and taste. Very crushable. Light pine and alcohol. This is almost a perfect dipa.

Many thanks to Rian for sharing!  Very nice floral nose. The beer starts fresh and smooth. Slightly sweetish with lots of floral hops. Pine, Resin, very sticky but still easy to drink. Nice floral finish. Fresh hops, very floral. Fresh and smooth, fruity citrus-tropical aftertaste, very fresh hops. Nice hoppy floral sweetish (but not too sweet) aftertaste. Great!

Sample at Tomahawk Warriors First Birthday party on 06/06/2015: Slightly hazy golden color with a medium white head that recedes steadily. Small patches of lacing on the glass. The aroma consists of citrus fruits, hops and bready malt. Medium body with flavors of grapefruit, herbal hops and biscuit malt. The finish is fruity with a passion fruit and citrusy hops aftertaste. Very good beer overall.

Thanks Rob!! Pours a brilliant light gold with a nice of white head. The smell is big citrus, toasted malt, pineapple. The taste is citrus, pineapple, dry and slightly bitter. Light/medium in body with elegant carbonation, great stuff!
Bottle. Yellow pour with a white head. Muted citrus hop bouquet. Taste follows suit with sturdy caramel malt backbone. Good body and mouthfeel.

Tasting at Bjorn and Sannes place. Thanks for sharing the beers!
APPEARANCE: light clouded blond beer, small stable white head.
NOSE: hoppy, bitter, fruity.
TASTE: hoppy, bitter, fruity, balanced!

bottle, from Brewery. dated 05/19/15, assuming its bottling date and not a best by date. real ggod aroma, sweet, peach,orange. tad hazed golden orange color, good head and lace, bitter sweet flavor. medium body, creamy slick mouthfeel, bitter dry finish, its pretty good, aroma best part, IMO, flavor more narrowly bitter, on the citrus side. not the biggest of IIPA/ s but very nice, easy to drink at 8%
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: Big thanks to Matt for this one, a real quench-thirster which is odd atthis ABV. It has your stereotypical trillium malts, light, some wheat, very low sweetness, then a ton of citrus and very juicy orange and pineapple flavors. Finish is hop flavors, not bitterness. Love it.

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2015 Pours a cloudy amber orange color with a fluffy white head. Aroma is floral, tropical and citrus fruits, and pine. Flavor is grapefruit, passionfruit, pine, some melon, hints of alcohol. Full body with a creamy texture to it. Lively carbonation and bitter to end. Solid all around beer.
bottle, hazy yellow, aroma is slight onion, dank pine and citrus. Full body citrus and dank DIPA, so easy to drink, amazing beer
Pours a hazy golden yellow from the bomber with minimal head or lace. Aroma of big citrus resinous hops, sweet and fruity. Taste follows, wow awesome hop profile, amazing!

Bottle less than a week old. Cloudy yellow gold. Nose is classic massive grapefruit, light pine, orange citrus, aromas. Taste follows-perfect balance, light minerality. Favorite of the three IPAs I got to try from these guys.

Bottled 04/25/15. Pours light golden color, hazy. Aroma is tropical fruits, citrus hops, light pilsner malt. Flavor is similar, tropical fruits lots of citrus. Very light body for such a big beer. Pretty amazing though.

25.4 ounces of such perfect hop character and malt balance. The best session IPA Ive ever had, youd never ever guess this was a double IPA. Cloudy and orange with a huge, everlasting bright white head. Orange blossom nose, hints of bubblegum and white pepper in there.. Didnt expect the juicy, over-ripe citrus flavors that ride to the grapefruity finish. Sparkly and light mouthfeel, I dont know how this almost-murky beer is so light on the tongue. This is, simply, amazing.

750ml bottle in a tulip. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of strong fruity and citrusy hops, some pale malts, and some light dough. Flavor the same with a great fruity and citrusy hoppiness that is balanced well. Average texture. Another great beer from Trillium.

Hazy yellow pour, appearing almost like a pineapple juice. Pineapple, pith, grapefruit rind, garlic, and onion in the nose. A bit of earthy taste along with tropical fruits. Another solid effort by Trillium. Well done.

Bottle - thanks jamvt! Pours cloudy amger orange, large creamy white head, dissipates fairly slowly with good lacing left behind. Aroma is perfume, passionfruit, dank leaves, sweat, pine fronds, melon. Flavor is light sweet, medium bitter, juicy, fruity, pine, dank, cat piss. Full bodied and creamy. Yum.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours hazy blond with high white head. Very nice lacing. Aroma is of resin, pine, tropical fruits. Taste is of resin, pine, tropical fruits, bitterness, sugar. Palate: Medium-full bodied. Medium carbonation. Well-balanced. Overall: Never harsh. Awesome balance. No alcohol warmth. A masterpiece.
Hazy pale yellow pour. White head. Massive hoppy nose. Spicy hops. Nice level of bitterness. Clean finish. Tasty.

UPDATED: AUG 23, 2015 bottle courtesy of tom10101, many thanks for this one bro! pours cloudy but glowing golden with a very creamy white head, good lacing. danky and minty citrus, garlic and onions, ginger, tropical chewy/meaty mangoes, doughy and cushy honeyed maltiness - never sweet, rather smooth. light carboantion, medium body - oily; incredibly balanced, smooth and fluffy citrusy finish. exceptional..

Thanks to czar/tom10101/whoever for sharing this bottle. Pours a hazy golden with a medium white head that leaves nice lacing. Nose is an impressive mix of citrus, pine and tropical fruits. Taste is of tangerines, oranges and other citruses. Juicy with cereals taking the back seat and only appearing to make sure it is perfectly balanced (toward hops) and never harsh. Moderately sweet and bitter. Body is medium, carbonation too and mouthfeel is just juicy. Overall an awesome drink, really. Not sure what was off with our bottle but I would drink that all the time! ;)

750mL bottle, pours a cloudy dark golden orange with a small white head. Nose is dank as fuck, with truckloads of juicy pot-like hops. Flavour is actually fairly mellow for a IIPA, with dank citrus hops, a little pine, and biscuity malt. Wonderfully balanced and quite restrained for a double IPA. Smooth and highly drinkable. Excellent.

Bottle brought by my cousin for afternoon hang. Hazy yellow orange with sudsy head. Nose is amazing tropical fruits, some pine and resin. Tastes of mango, pineapple, melon, grapefruit, resin, pine caramel, candied sugar, some grass. Nice rich mouthfeel or fruit. Wonderful.

Bottle, courtesy of a chill br, shared in a location remote of my living room. 
Pours a hazy yellow with a big head and nice lacing on the glass.

The aroma is fruit forward hops, melon, orange, some leafiness. Very low malt character, very pungent, extraordinarily appetizing. 

The flavor has plenty of melon & grapefruit. The hop character is bright, punchy & satisfying. Its nicely bitter, perhaps more so than youre typical nouveau IPA, but it works well here and is more on the medium as opposed to moderate end. The alcohol character is very low.
 
wonderful.
Bottle brought by BBQSlim. Thanks so much. Very dry, bitter, grapefruit, one of the better IPAs Imve had.

Bottle shared. Glowing hazy gold pour with white head. Aroma is really nice and dank, all that sublime trillium hop aroma, very piney, intense resinous aroma. Taste is really bitter, very hoppy, tons of resinous pine, lots of grapefruit, light floury flavor. Palate is med full bodied with good carbonation. Really nice stuff, living up to the name.

Live from NH! Bottle (750 ml). Bottled 06-04-2015. From Jon, thanks! Split 3-ways with Chris and Julien.

Appearance: Cloudy glowing yellow-orange with medium white head and heavy lacing. 

Aroma: Pineapples, piney notes, grass, resin, honeyed notes, doughy malts and light melons.

Taste: Piney, pineapples, moderate honeyed sweetness, grass, resin, doughy malts and moderate bitterness.

Palate: Medium body. Moderate to medium carbonation. Less oily mouthfeel than most trillium. Moderately dry finish. 

Overall: Good DIPA. Doesnt have the Trillium "essential oils" kick that theres in most Trillium hoppy beers but its still a tasty and quite easily drinkable DIPA.
Huge tropical nose and slight bitterness. Very well balanced. The taste is out of this world.

Pour is a dark amber, extremely hazed, light edges, tight white head that lingers for a little and leaves a thick lacing. Nose has a rich tropical fruit presence, pineapple, peach, light orange citrus, a bit of caramel malt and notes of resin. Body is full and heavy, assertive carb, gets a touch sticky. Some sweet malt backbone, a little sugary, hops are super aggressive, Peach, citrus, faint resin. Finish is fairly bitter and takes away from the clean hop flavors slightly.

Fresh bottle purchased from the brewery and drunk later the night of 4/10/15Pours a rather hazy orange-gold with a very strong, large, well-retained, white head.Beautiful nose has both elements of tropical fruits as well as some more standard orange/grapefruit/pine. Not quite the lush, juicy strength of Upper Case and theres more resin displayed here, which Im never much a fan of, but the alcohol is under control and the malt adds only moderately sweet honey to help balance.The flavor is a mixed bag for me. On one hand, the same luscious tropical fruits are here and provide enjoyable flavors of pineapple, mango and such, but theres a bit of blandness from the hops still in suspension and to go with that, a bit too much pine-like acidity. The brighter, lighter notes are inevitably consumed by the grapefruit/resin bitterness and resulting acidity. That being said, its not outrageously acidic and to be quite honest, as it warmed up, the malt actually became a bit too sweet. Too cake-like and sugary, though I wouldnt go as far as to call it syrupy. Obviously, then, the resulting texture is very soft and coupled with the natural carbonation, makes that part of the experience enjoyable.Kind of an "Old-style American DIPA", as in, more bitter/C-hop forward and with plenty of maltiness. Still enjoyable but theres just a better breed of IPA/DIPA being brewed these days (including many of Trilliums other beers).
Pours a hazy orange with a bright white laving. Pungent grapefruit and tangerine aromas, creamsicle and weed. Flavor is sweet with a mildly finished bitter finish

Hazy dark orange body, medium to large white head, dense soapy lacing. Mango, papaya, sticky grapefruit, some resin, just a tiny bit of vegetal notes, finished off with some pine. Medium bodied with mellow carbonation. Assertive carbonation, semi-dry throughout, and minimal booziness.
Bottle. Rating 9,800. Pours yellow gold white head. Nose/taste of green onion, sugared grapefruit, cracker malt, citrus and lemon. Medium body.

The beer is a tannish burnt orange color. Rocky off white head. Lots of lacing. Nice sweet tropical fruit hops in the aroma. Little malt character. Very nice. The taste is light and full of hop fruit flavor. Mango, pineapple, a little papaya, mild tangerine. Good stuff. No real malt sweetness but it is fairly sweet. It makes me think of hoppy beers that stay away from early hop additions. Moderate bitterness in the finish. Solid DIPA.

Pours unclear yellow . Smell is extremely fruity . 
Taste is bitter , fruity ( grassy , lemon , lime, .. ) very complex . Nice intensity , almost perfect mouthfeel .
Trillium does it again. Golden orange hazy color. Aroma is tropical fruits, doughy, orange peel, light resin, and grass. Taste is medium chewy sweet with mild bitterness.

Poured from a 750 ml bottle. 
Aroma is very hop forward with a light, background malt character. Lots of tropical fruit and citrus with lighter stone fruit and resin. Pineapple mango and guava are most prevalent. 
Pours a cloudy, pale, golden orange with some copper hues and a thick, white head that exhibits nice retention. High lacing and small legs. 
Flavor is somewhat sweet with a slight honey character and some light caramel notes. Rather strong bitterness with a light alcohol spice in the finish. Moderate orange and grapefruit notes with some light stone fruit, especially peach. Moderate tropical fruit with mango being most prevalent. Hints of resin and melon. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a nice IPA with a lot of tropical and stone fruit. A little sweet and malty for my preferences, but the hop character is nice and works well with the sweetness.

750 ml bottle thanks going to Willrunforbeer. Aroma is mango, grapefruit and a mild pine. Sugar covered fruit notes. 
  
Flavor is sweet mango, apricots, upfront. Orange rind and a good level of malt through the center. The finish shows me light grass and a light level of pine. Bitterness show a nice lingering affect. I enjoyed this a lot, nice stuff.

Bottle from trade, thanks Anthony! Pours cloudy yellow, straw with a white head. Aroma is orange, mango, grapefruit. Flavor follows, caramel, orange, mango, grapefruit. Grapefruit and pine bitterness in the finish.

Poured from bottle thanks Willrunforbeer. Hazy golden color with thin white head. Aromas of sweet citrus and caramel. Taste is smooth and clean with a nice citrus hit and a nice balanced light hop finish. A great beer.

Beer beer beer beer. Delicious. Beer beer. Beer. Trillium. Beer. IPA. Delicious beer. I really like this beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours hazy white grapefruit into a snifter. Bright white head with medium retention recedes leaving trailing lacing. Sweet caramel, yeast and resin aromas. Soft with sweet caramel and sugar cookie dough upfront turning dry grapefruit and mango before the lasting pith finish.

Hazy golden yellow color, moderate white head. Slightly subdued aroma of grapefruit, pine, citrus rind, a little hay, and floral notes. Mild sweetness, then surprisingly moderate bitterness. Lively, medium body, a bit slick, and just a little booziness.
